Key Arguments: The legislation contradicts the government's proposal to give greater expression to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
The bill threatens the democratic way of life by restricting freedom of speech and the free exchange of thoughts and information.
ACMA would have excessive power to determine what content could cause harm, which is seen as undemocratic and akin to totalitarian states.
The government should trust the Australian people to make informed decisions rather than imposing such restrictions.
Alternative approaches should be explored that do not infringe upon freedom of speech and liberties.
Notable Quotes: This Bill gives god-like powers to ACMA to prevent the DM Platforms from allowing any content they consider could ‘cause harm’!
How can we not be absolutely appalled by this proposal as it more closely resembles the modus operandi of totalitarian states.

The Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation Bill 2023 must not be accepted into Australian Law. It is un-Australian & unDemocratic as it would silence ‘the voices’ of the wonderful people of Australia.
